Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
fix: entity detection and user-friendly progress messages

Entity detection:
- Group entities by canonical name only \(not label+name\) to unify "Laura" mentions
- Add overlap filtering to prefer longer entity matches
- Filter Spanish punctuation from entity boundaries

Progress UX:
- Per-character progress during attribute analysis \("Analizando: Laura García 3/175"\)
- User-friendly phase names \(no technical terms like spaCy, NER, LLM\)
- Better loading message in DocumentViewer \("El contenido aparecerá en breve"\)

Fixes:
- DocumentAlreadyExistsError severity changed to FATAL for proper detection
- LLM client warns only once when unavailable \(no repeated warnings\)
- httpx added to api-server requirements for Ollama connection

UI improvements:
- AlertsTab resolve-all confirmation dialog
- Various theme and styling improvements

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Editorial Assistant v1.0.0 - Complete implementation

Major Features:
- 12 editorial correction detectors \(typography, repetitions, agreement,
  terminology, regional vocabulary, field terminology, clarity, grammar,
  anglicisms, crutch words, fillers, readability\)
- Sequential correction mode UI for efficient workflow
- Glossary management system \(CRUD, LLM context, export\)
- Track Changes export for Word documents
- AlertFormatter utility for centralized formatting
- useAlertUtils composable for frontend code deduplication
- Consolidated alert status API endpoints

UI Improvements:
- ResumenTab with chapter density visualization
- EntitiesTab with attribute refresh on re-analysis
- DocumentViewer with retry mechanism for highlight timing
- DsInput component migration across 6+ files
- StyleTab with filler and readability analysis

Backend Improvements:
- _verify_entity_ownership and _verify_alert_ownership helpers
- AlertFormatter for context formatting \(DRY\)
- Filler detector and readability analyzer
- Title preprocessing for better entity extraction

Documentation:
- ROADMAP_V2.md with ideas from Stilus and MeaningCloud
- EDITORIAL_ASSISTANT_ROADMAP.md updated with implementation status
- E2E test specs for attribute extraction and alerts

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")

Bash(git tag -a v1.0.0 -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
Release v1.0.0 - Editorial Assistant Complete

This is the first stable release of Narrative Assistant as a complete
editorial assistant tool for professional proofreaders and editors.

## Highlights

### Editorial Correction Detectors \(12\)
- Typography \(dashes, quotes, spacing\)
- Lexical repetitions
- Gender/number agreement
- Inconsistent terminology
- Regional vocabulary \(es_ES, es_MX\)
- Field-specific terminology
- Clarity/Style \(long sentences\)
- Grammar \(leísmo, dequeísmo\)
- Anglicisms
- Author crutch words
- Filler detection
- Readability analysis \(Flesch-Szigriszt\)

### Workflow Features
- Sequential correction mode
- Glossary management \(CRUD, LLM context, export\)
- Track Changes export for Word
- Detailed correction reports

### Technical Improvements
- Centralized AlertFormatter utility
- useAlertUtils composable \(DRY\)
- Consolidated API endpoints
- E2E test coverage

### Documentation
- ROADMAP_V2.md with future plans
- Ideas from Stilus and MeaningCloud research

## Requirements
- Python 3.11+
- Ollama \(optional, for LLM features\)
- ~2GB disk for NLP models

## Known Issues
- Code signing pending \(Windows/macOS certificates required\)
EOF
\)")

Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Add Python detection and missing Python UI for initial setup

- Add find_python_executable\(\) with version checking \(Python 3.10+\)
- Add /api/system/python-status endpoint for frontend status checking
- Include python_available, python_version, python_path in /api/models/status
- Add ''python-missing'' phase to ModelSetupDialog with clear instructions
- Show Python version requirements and download link when Python not found
- Track Python status in system store for frontend state management

This improves the user experience when the installed app cannot find
a compatible Python installation for NLP dependency installation.

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
\)")
